intro: Peucedanum muliense, commonly known as Chinese cow parsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Peucedanum muliense is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine.
